scenarioDescription:
The G 264-012 Exoplanetary System


Overview

G 264-012 is a star with 0.3 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.3 times its radius. It is located 52.21 light years away from the solar system.

G 264-012 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the G 264-012 system


G 264-012 b

G 264-012 b was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory, in 2021-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of G 264-012 b is 2.503 times the mass of Earth. The radius of G 264-012 b is 1.390 that of Earth. At 2.503 Earth masses, G 264-012 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


G 264-012 c

G 264-012 c was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory, in 2021-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of G 264-012 c is 3.752 times the mass of Earth. The radius of G 264-012 c is 1.760 that of Earth. At 3.752 Earth masses, G 264-012 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system G 264-012, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory.
name: G 264-012 - System With 2 Exoplanets
